name: Tattooed By The Family Business
description:
A tattoo book like no other, Tattooed by the Family Business focuses on the work of Mo Coppoletta and The Family Business, based in London’s Exmouth Market. Visually taking us through the creative and physical process of having a tattoo, this book is as much an inspirational design source as a peek into the private world of the tattoo parlour, its artists and clients. From the first traces to the finished design, the characters and equipments used, this book reflects the status of the tattoo as a truly twenty-first century art form.

Mo Coppoletta is one of the world’s most respected tattoo artists. He established The Family Business Tattoo shop in 2003 in the heart of London with the aim of creating a new setting for tattoo enthusiasts – a shop with a different approach and a unique environment. The Family Business has built a strong following and is now internationally renowned for its high standards of creativity and talented artists.

Hardback, 208 pages
Published in 2010 by Pavilion Books
Photography © Fredi Marcarini and Chris Terry

name: Vouchers
description:
Available in various amounts, posted to your door.
A 3.5% surcharge has been added to cover processing fees.


This item is not refundable. Please contact us on info@thefamilybusinesstattoo.com if you have any further inquiry.

description:

Available in White with black logo or
Navy with white logo.

name: Card Holders
description:
Limited edition vinyl card holders released exclusively for The Family Business Tattoo 10th year anniversary. Ideal for all sorts of cards (Oyster, business, debit cards.... ) 

Free, limited edition, 10 year anniversary stickers available with this order!

name: Mo Coppoletta's print set
description:
Full set of archival quality digital prints with gold embossing
Published in 2013
Signed and numbered by the artist in pencil
Sheet size: 15x8 inches
Edition Size: 100 of each design

name: Mo Coppoletta's screen print set
description:
The full set of limited edition A2 screen print signed and numbered by Mo Coppoletta.

These luscious, bold prints have been hand pulled in London. The saturation of the ink combined with the grain of the imported Italian heavy stock produces a very vibrant, rich, luxurious finish.

The prints in this series are strictly limited to 25 of each design.



Hand pulled 2 layer screenprints
Published in 2013
Signed and numbered by the artist in pencil
Sheet size: A2
Edition Size: 25 of each design

name: Mo Coppoletta - Pulvis - Limited Edition Print
description:
Hora Incerta Prints

Product information	

HORA INCERTA
“Uncertain Hour”

No medium can actually match the crude, in your face power of the skull image, as a warning on the frailty of life and its passing.

The biblical “Vanitas Vanitatum et Omnia Vanitas” gave birth to the Vanitas pictorial representation in the 17th century,the warning on how life is transient and its inexorable passing by, was represented by obviously the skull together with a burnt candle, a dying fruit or flower and its falling petals(tulip or more often rose), a hourglass. Sometimes the skull was winged or sitting on top of a tortoise to symbolise how slow time flies by. The fragile condition of human life must be reminded,to put everything into perspective.

Deeply influenced by any illustration work spanning from  18Th century etchings till 1920s graphics, in the Hora Incerta set I wanted to explore the possibilities to represent the same concept using just black ink, a connubium between the finely etched strong imagery and the graphic framework around them, in order to create an harmonious yet powerful set of illustrations.

Limited Edition Giclee Prints, Featured in Mo’s first solo exhibition.

Giclee with embossing, 2011
Each print signed and numbered by the artist in pencil
Sheet size: 46 x 34cm
Edition Size: 50

name: Mo Coppoletta - Fisso L'Idea II - Limited Edition Print
description:
FISSO L’IDEA
“I Fix the Idea”

An Autobiographical work, depicting and reclaiming the Artists’ duty to physically intervene on the final work. A celebration of the interaction between the mental (Idea) and manual (Fisso/Fix) process; mind and hand working together to visualize and materialize any inspiration or commission.

Only through the connection between the 2 above the artist will infuse an added value to the Work, defining the sometimes blurred line between art and craft, between design and art, between decorative and fine art.

A manifesto to celebrate the Vision/genius of the Artist but also the materialization of it through manual skills and experience.

Screenprint with glazes and silver foiling
Published in 2011
Signed and numbered by the artist in pencil
Sheet size: 70 x 31.7cm
Edition Size: 100
